intro: Schismatoglottis treubii f. viridipes, commonly known as the Emerald Lady, is a rare and striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its elongated, dark green leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle, giving them a glossy appearance. The plant produces small, pale green flowers that are clustered in a raceme, typical of many orchid species. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, where it thrives in shaded, humid environments. Due to its unique appearance and rarity, it is highly sought after by orchid enthusiasts and botanists alike.
